item.title: Apple Intelligence will support more languages from April
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Apple’s AI suite, Apple Intelligence, will soon be available in French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, and simplified Chinese, along with localized English versions for India and Singapore. During the company’s Q4 2024 quarterly results call on Thursday, CEO Tim Cook said that the company will roll out support for these additional languages in […]

item.title: In another challenging year for startups, higher valuations and revenue give reason for hope
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Want it in your inbox every Friday? Sign up here. The aftermath of DeepSeek’s launch was arguably the biggest tech story of the week, especially for anyone keeping a close eye on public markets. But private companies, […]

item.title: Intel has already received $2.2B in federal grants for chip production
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Semiconductor giant Intel Corporation has already received $2.2 billion in federal grants from the U.S. Department of Commerce through the U.S. CHIPS and Science Act, the company shared during its Thursday earnings call. Dave Zinsner, Intel’s co-interim CEO, executive vice president, and CFO, said the Silicon Valley-based company received the first tranche of $1.1 billion […]

item.title: Pentagon scrambles to block DeepSeek after employees connect to Chinese servers
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
The Pentagon is rushing to block DeepSeek on its network after some employees used the service, which stores data in China.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apple tops 1 billion subscriptions, nearly $100B in services revenue in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Apple’s iPhone sales may be down, but the company’s Services division, which includes the App Store, iCloud, Music, TV+, and other subscriptions, is still soaring. The Cupertino-based tech giant reported Thursday its Services business had an all-time revenue high of $26.3 billion for the quarter ended December 28, up 14% year-over-year. Services generated nearly $100 […]

item.title: Apple CEO says DeepSeek shows ‘innovation that drives efficiency’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Apple CEO Tim Cook said DeepSeek’s AI models represent “innovation that drives efficiency” during an earnings call Thursday while fielding questions from analysts about the iPhone maker’s AI ambitions. “In general, I think innovation that drives efficiency is a good thing. And, you know, that’s what you see in that model,” said Cook, responding to […]

item.title: Google quietly announces its next flagship AI model
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Update: Some users on social media report that the changelog has been updated to remove mention of Gemini 2.0 Pro Experimental. The references have disappeared for this reporter as well. A Google spokesperson told TechCrunch that an “out-of-date release note” was “published in error.” The original story follows: Google took the low-key route for the […]

item.title: Intel won’t bring its Falcon Shores AI chip to market
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Intel is effectively killing Falcon Shores, its next-generation GPU for high-performance computing and AI workloads. The move comes as Intel tries to correct course after a number of disappointing product launches and historic losses, while competitors like AMD and Nvidia gain ground. Intel co-CEO Michelle Johnston Holthaus said during the company’s fourth-quarter earnings call Thursday […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apple quarterly revenue increases, even as China sales decline 11%
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apple’s latest earnings were a mixed bag, with slipping iPhone sales countered by rising revenue. Reporting after the bell Thursday, the iPhone maker’s overall revenue in the first quarter of 2025 beat Wall Street expectations, with a 4% bump to $124.3 billion over the same time last year. Apple reported net income of $36.33 billion, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk reveals Elon Musk was wrong about Full Self-Driving
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
For nearly nine years, Elon Musk has promised Tesla vehicles had the hardware needed to support a self-driving car. This week, he made his latest admission that many are not. Musk said on a conference call Wednesday evening that Tesla cars equipped with so-called Hardware 3 will need an upgrade before they can support unsupervised […]

item.title: OpenAI said to be in talks to raise $40B at a $340B valuation
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI may have billions of dollars in the bank. But it’s gearing up to raise billions more, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal. Per The WSJ, OpenAI is in talks to secure up to $40 billion in a funding round that would value the startup at $340 billion. SoftBank would lead the […]

item.title: Controversial genetics testing startup Nucleus Genomics raises $14M Series A
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
The company, founded by 25-year-old Kian Sadeghi, announced a $14 million Series A, bringing its total funding to about $32 million.

item.title: Fintech startup Cushion shuts down after 8 years and over $20 million in funding
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Cushion, a fintech startup that described itself as the “Plaid for buy now, pay later (BNPL),” has shut down. On Thursday, founder and CEO Paul Kesserwani posted on LinkedIn about the decision to wind down the company at the end of 2024. In the post, Kesserwani said that “despite bringing multiple new fintech products to […]

item.title: Serial founder DIVINE launches creator app with hip-hop legend RAKIM
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Serial entrepreneur and former recording artist Victor D. Lombard, also known as DIVINE, announced this week the launch of a new company, in partnership with RAKIM, one of hip-hop’s most influential emcees.  The company is called Notes, a fintech specifically for independent urban musicians and creators. It provides the knowledge and tools to help artists […]

item.title: AngelSense exposed location data and personal information of tracked users
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
The exposed database was connected to the internet without a password, exposing GPS coordinates, names, phone numbers, and postal addresses.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google’s ‘Ask for Me’ feature calls businesses on your behalf to inquire about services, pricing
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Google is testing a new “Ask for Me” feature that uses AI to call local businesses on your behalf, for information about availability and pricing. The feature is available on desktop and mobile for users who have opted into the company’s Search Labs experiments. The idea is to help users access information without having to […]

item.title: a16z has venture scouts scattered across Europe
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Despite news that Andreessen Horowitz closed its London crypto-focused office, the VC reportedly still has dozens of scouts in Europe looking for startups.

item.title: Google issues ‘voluntary exit’ program for Android, Chrome, and Pixel employees
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Google SVP Rick Osterloh issued an internal memo to the Pixel/Android/Chrome team Thursday, announcing a “voluntary exit program.” TechCrunch has confirmed the letter’s existence with the company, after it was first reported by 9 to 5 Google. In a statement to TechCrunch, a spokesperson notes: The Platforms & Devices team is offering a voluntary exit […]

item.title: Amazon cuts jobs in Sustainability department
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Amazon is eliminating roles in its Communications and Sustainability departments, per an internal memo seen by TechCrunch.
